 Determines whether the item is stackable or not.

Detailed Description

Class representing an item that can be overlayed onto the map. Each overlay will belong to a layer once added to the map.

Member Function Documentation

wf_uint32 WFAPI::OverlayItem::addImageSpec ( ImageSpec *  imgSpec  ) 

Adds an image representation which can be used by the zoom spec or other specs to represent this OverlayItem. The items are numbered in the order they were added - the first image added will get index 0, and so forth. For extra clarity, the id is returned.

Parameters:
imgSpec The image specification to add.
Returns:
id The resulting id of the added image.

static OverlayItem* WFAPI::OverlayItem::allocate ( const OverlayItemZoomSpec *  zoomSpec,
MapObjectInfo *  mapObjectInfo,
const WGS84Coordinate &  position 
) [static]

Exactly the same as the previous method, but instead of copying the MapObjectInfo the ownership is transferred.

Initially the reference count will be set to 1. Once you are done with this object, you will need to call removeReference to ensure that the object is properly deallocated.

static OverlayItem* WFAPI::OverlayItem::allocate ( const OverlayItemZoomSpec *  zoomSpec,
const MapObjectInfo &  mapObjectInfo,
const WGS84Coordinate &  position 
) [static]

Creates a new overlay item that can be placed on a layer.

Initially the reference count will be set to 1. Once you are done with this object, you will need to call removeReference to ensure that the object is properly deallocated.

Parameters:
zoomSpec The zoom specification for the item, containing visual specifications for different zoom ranges. The reference count will be increased during the lifetime of this OverlayItem.
mapObjectInfo The information object associated with this item, containing descriptions and other properties. Will be copied internally.
position The position of the overlay item, either in screen or world coordinates.

const ImageSpec* WFAPI::OverlayItem::getImageSpec ( wf_uint32  id  )  const

Returns an image spec corresponding to the supplied id. If no such image spec exists, NULL will be returned.

const MapObjectInfo& WFAPI::OverlayItem::getMapObjectInfo (  )  const

Returns:
The map object info associated with this overlay item.

const WGS84Coordinate& WFAPI::OverlayItem::getPosition (  )  const

Returns:
The position of this overlay item.

const OverlayItemZoomSpec* WFAPI::OverlayItem::getZoomSpec (  )  const

Returns:
The zoom specification of this overlay item.

const bool WFAPI::OverlayItem::isStackable (  )  const

Returns:
True if the item is stackable.

void WFAPI::OverlayItem::removeAllImageSpec (  ) 

To remove all image spec. If to change image for an overlayItem, first call this function and then add new imageSpec using addImageSpec function.

virtual void WFAPI::OverlayItem::setPosition ( const WGS84Coordinate &  position  )  [pure virtual]

Sets the position of the overlay item. This position be used to draw the object on the map.

Parameters:
position The position of the overlay item, either in screen or world coordinates.

void WFAPI::OverlayItem::setStackable ( bool  stackable  ) 

Sets the stackability of the item.

Parameters:
stackable If true, the item will be stackable.
